Semantic html5 tags and how to use them.

29 Aug 2014

What is a semantic tag?

Here are a few examples of semantic html tags:

  <header>, <nav>, <article>, <img>, <h1>
  • Semantic tags clearly define the purpouse and meaning of the content they hold.
In the codepen below is an example of semantic html code:

See the Pen qkEbt by Tryggvi Gylfason (@tryggvigy) on CodePen.

check the Result tab to see the page

So what is NOT semantic HTML code?

  <div>, <span>

  • Some tags do not "tell" you anything about the content inside of them These tags are "non-semantic" or "presentation only" tags.

  • There is nothing wrong with using these tags and in fact can often be very useful and are widely used.

  • The reasoning behind using semantic HTML tags is to avoid "div-hell" on webpages.

Lessons learned

Think twice about the tags you use.

When writing HTML, try to use the tag that makes the most sense each time. This will make your code more readable and easier to manage.

Good luck with project 1!
